Paul Buhle Collection on Social Humor TAM.264
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive
1
0.5 linear feet (1 box)
1970s-1980s
Buhle, Paul, 1944-
Historical/Biographical Note
Paul Buhle (b. 1944), is an historian of the American Left, and was the founding editor of the journal Radical America (1967–1999), and founder of Cultural Correspondence (1977–83), a journal of popular culture studies, and a founder and director of the Oral History of the American Left archive at New York University.
Scope and Contents note
The collection consists of correspondence that contains discussion of publishing humor material in Cultural Correspondence, plans to start a new mass circulation humor magazine, and the creation of an international radical humor movement. The collection also contains a number of radical humor publications from around the country.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Use Restrictions
Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Paul Buhle are held by Paul Buhle. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which he holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Paul Buhle.
Access Restrictions
Open for research without restrictions.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Paul Buhle Collection on Social Humor; TAM 264; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition note
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number 1950.107 is associated with this collection.
